title: Developers
text: developing pkg locally, can clone repo, open gpgr.Rproj RStudio, work devtools. ‚Äôll also need install roxytest get tests documentation working.

title: Developers
text: Instead committing big data files git, can store files remotely (e.g.¬†Google Drive, AWS S3) just keep track data updates git using DVC. R package uses data files running code examples tests, rendering vignettes. simple dvc pull pull data remote storage allow processes take place.

title: Developers
text: DVC, make sure install dvc corresponding remote package e.g.¬†dvc-gdrive, dvc-s3 etc., else ‚Äôll get something completely puzzling like:
code: WARNING: No file hash info found for 'FOO.txt'. It won't be created. ERROR: failed to pull data from the cloud - Checkout failed for following targets: Is your cache up to date? <https://error.dvc.org/missing-files>

title: Developers
text: Make sure source points source path instead git_url/git_tag, else dev branch pulling main branch ‚Äôll pulling (remaining) hair .

title: PURPLE
text: PURPLE: Purity Ploidy Estimator (https://github.com/hartwigmedical/hmftools/tree/master/purple). PURPLE combines B-allele frequency, read depth ratios, small variants structural variants estimate purity copy number profile tumor sample. outputs several files, displayed .

title: PURPLE
text: PURPLE Somatic CNVs (per chromosome) Columns. PURPLE Somatic CNVs (per chromosome) Summary Table.
code: cnv_som <- system.file("extdata/purple/purple.cnv.somatic.tsv", package = "gpgr") |>   gpgr::purple_cnv_som_process() cnv_som$descr |>   knitr::kable(caption = "PURPLE Somatic CNVs (per chromosome) Columns.") cnv_som$tab |>   dplyr::slice(1:10) |>   knitr::kable(caption = "PURPLE Somatic CNVs (per chromosome) Summary Table.")

title: PURPLE
text: PURPLE Somatic CNVs (per gene) Columns. PURPLE Somatic CNVs (per gene) Summary Table.
code: umccr_key_genes <- system.file("extdata/ref/somatic_panel-v24.03.0.tsv", package = "gpgr") cnv_som_gene <- system.file("extdata/purple/purple.cnv.gene.tsv", package = "gpgr") |>   gpgr::purple_cnv_som_gene_process(g = umccr_key_genes) cnv_som_gene$descr |>   knitr::kable(caption = "PURPLE Somatic CNVs (per gene) Columns.") cnv_som_gene$tab |>   dplyr::slice(1:10) |>   knitr::kable(caption = "PURPLE Somatic CNVs (per gene) Summary Table.")

title: PURPLE
text: PURPLE Purity Summary Table.
code: purity <- system.file("extdata/purple/purple.purity.tsv", package = "gpgr") |>   gpgr::purple_purity_read()  purity$summary |>   knitr::kable(caption = "PURPLE Purity Summary Table.")

title: PURPLE
text: PURPLE QC Summary Table.
code: qc <- system.file("extdata/purple/purple.qc", package = "gpgr") |>   gpgr::purple_qc_read()  qc$summary |>   knitr::kable(caption = "PURPLE QC Summary Table.")

title: PURPLE
text: Main packages used vignette. Platform information.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Peter Diakumis. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Diakumis P (2025). gpgr: Genomics Platform Group Reporting. https://umccr.github.io/gpgr/, https://github.com/umccr/gpgr.
code: @Manual{,   title = {gpgr: Genomics Platform Group Reporting},   author = {Peter Diakumis},   year = {2025},   note = {https://umccr.github.io/gpgr/, https://github.com/umccr/gpgr}, }

title: Genomics Platform Group Reporting
text: Contains reports functions used Genomics Platform Group University Melbourne Centre Cancer Research. Docs: https://umccr.github.io/gpgr/

title: Genomics Platform Group Reporting
text: used inside conda environment:
code: remotes::install_github("umccr/gpgr") conda install r-gpgr -c umccr -c conda-forge -c bioconda

title: Genomics Platform Group Reporting
text: Read process output files PURPLE purity/copy number estimator tool Hartwig Medical Foundation (https://github.com/hartwigmedical/hmftools/tree/master/purple). See vignette https://umccr.github.io/gpgr/articles/purple.html.

title: Genomics Platform Group Reporting
text: https://github.com/scwatts/sash. See CLI section options.

title: Genomics Platform Group Reporting
text: See https://umccr.github.io/gpgr/articles/devnotes.html developer notes.

title: Genomics Platform Group Reporting
text: gpgr command line interface available convenience. ‚Äôre using conda package, gpgr.R command already set inside activated conda environment. ‚Äôre using conda package, need export gpgr/inst/cli/ directory PATH order use gpgr.R.
code: gpgr_cli=$(Rscript -e 'x = system.file("cli", package = "gpgr"); cat(x, "\n")' | xargs) export PATH="${gpgr_cli}:${PATH}" gpgr.R --version gpgr.R 2.1.0  #-----------------------------------# gpgr.R --help usage: gpgr.R [-h] [-v] {canrep} ...  UMCCR Genomics Platform Group Reporting  positional arguments:   {canrep}       sub-command help     canrep       UMCCR Cancer Report.  options:   -h, --help     show this help message and exit   -v, --version  show program's version number and exit  #-----------------------------------# #------- Cancer Report -------# gpgr.R canrep --help usage: gpgr.R canrep [-h] --af_global AF_GLOBAL --af_keygenes AF_KEYGENES                      --batch_name BATCH_NAME [--conda_list CONDA_LIST]                      --img_dir IMG_DIR --key_genes KEY_GENES --oncokb_genes                      ONCOKB_GENES --somatic_snv_vcf SOMATIC_SNV_VCF                      --somatic_snv_summary SOMATIC_SNV_SUMMARY                      --somatic_sv_tsv SOMATIC_SV_TSV --somatic_sv_vcf                      SOMATIC_SV_VCF --purple_som_gene_cnv PURPLE_SOM_GENE_CNV                      --purple_som_cnv_ann PURPLE_SOM_CNV_ANN --purple_som_cnv                      PURPLE_SOM_CNV --purple_purity PURPLE_PURITY --purple_qc                      PURPLE_QC --purple_som_snv_vcf PURPLE_SOM_SNV_VCF                      --virusbreakend_tsv VIRUSBREAKEND_TSV --virusbreakend_vcf                      VIRUSBREAKEND_VCF --dragen_hrd DRAGEN_HRD                      --bcftools_stats BCFTOOLS_STATS [--out_file OUT_FILE]                      [--quiet] --result_outdir RESULT_OUTDIR --tumor_name                      TUMOR_NAME  options:   -h, --help            show this help message and exit   --af_global AF_GLOBAL                         Path to `af_tumor.txt` file.   --af_keygenes AF_KEYGENES                         Path to `af_tumor_keygenes.txt` file.   --batch_name BATCH_NAME                         Name of batch sample.   --conda_list CONDA_LIST                         Path to `conda_pkg_list.txt` file.   --img_dir IMG_DIR     Path to directory containing PURPLE plots.   --key_genes KEY_GENES                         Path to UMCCR cancer gene file.   --oncokb_genes ONCOKB_GENES                         Path to OncoKB database file.   --somatic_snv_vcf SOMATIC_SNV_VCF                         Path to `somatic-PASS.vcf.gz` SNV VCF.   --somatic_snv_summary SOMATIC_SNV_SUMMARY                         Path to `somatic_snv_summary.json` JSON.   --somatic_sv_tsv SOMATIC_SV_TSV                         Path to `manta.tsv` TSV file.   --somatic_sv_vcf SOMATIC_SV_VCF                         Path to `manta.vcf.gz` VCF file.   --purple_som_gene_cnv PURPLE_SOM_GENE_CNV                         Path to `purple.cnv.gene.tsv`.   --purple_som_cnv_ann PURPLE_SOM_CNV_ANN                         Path to annotated and prioritised                         `purple.cnv.somatic.tsv`.   --purple_som_cnv PURPLE_SOM_CNV                         Path to `purple.cnv.somatic.tsv`.   --purple_purity PURPLE_PURITY                         Path to `purple.purity.tsv`.   --purple_qc PURPLE_QC                         Path to `purple.qc`.   --purple_som_snv_vcf PURPLE_SOM_SNV_VCF                         Path to `purple.somatic.vcf.gz`.   --virusbreakend_tsv VIRUSBREAKEND_TSV                         Path to VIRUSBreakend summary file.   --virusbreakend_vcf VIRUSBREAKEND_VCF                         Path to VIRUSBreakend VCF file.   --dragen_hrd DRAGEN_HRD                         Path to DRAGEN HRD file   --bcftools_stats BCFTOOLS_STATS                         Path to bcftools stats file   --out_file OUT_FILE   Path to output HTML file (needs '.html' suffix) [def:                         {tumor_name}_cancer_report.html].   --quiet               Suppress log printing during rendering.   --result_outdir RESULT_OUTDIR                         Path to directory to write tidy JSON/TSV results.   --tumor_name TUMOR_NAME                         Name of tumor sample.  #-----------------------------------#

text: effects Input string effects.

text: abbreviated string.

title: Abbreviate SV Effects ‚Äî abbreviate_effect
code: (e1 <- gpgr:::abbreviate_effect("3_prime_UTR_truncation&start_lost&splice_region_variant")) #> [1] "3UTRtrunc, SpliceRegV, StartLoss" (e2 <- gpgr:::abbreviate_effect("duplication&foo&gene_fusion&BOOM&intron_variant")) #> [1] "BOOM, Dup, foo, FusG, IntronV" (e3 <- gpgr:::abbreviate_effect("TF_binding_site_variant&TFBS_ablation")) #> [1] "TFBSDel, TFBSVar" (e4 <- gpgr:::abbreviate_effect("foo&bar&stop_gained&badaboom")) #> [1] "badaboom, bar, foo, StopGain"

title: Generate UMCCR Cancer Report ‚Äî cancer_rmd
text: Generates UMCCR Cancer Report. following steps: move img_dir 'tmp/img_dir' copy rmd 'tmp/cancer_report.Rmd' render rmd inside 'tmp/' return path output HTML

title: Generate UMCCR Cancer Report ‚Äî cancer_rmd
code: cancer_rmd(   af_global,   af_keygenes,   batch_name,   bcftools_stats,   conda_list,   img_dir,   key_genes,   oncokb_genes,   virusbreakend_tsv,   virusbreakend_vcf,   purple_purity,   purple_qc,   purple_som_cnv_ann,   purple_som_cnv,   purple_som_gene_cnv,   purple_som_snv_vcf,   somatic_snv_vcf,   somatic_snv_summary,   somatic_sv_tsv,   somatic_sv_vcf,   result_outdir,   tumor_name,   dragen_hrd = NULL,   out_file = NULL,   quiet = FALSE )

title: Generate UMCCR Cancer Report ‚Äî cancer_rmd
text: af_global Path af_tumor.txt file. af_keygenes Path af_tumor_keygenes.txt file. batch_name Name batch sample. bcftools_stats Path bcftools_stats.txt file. conda_list Path conda_pkg_list.txt file. img_dir Path directory containing PURPLE plots. key_genes Path UMCCR cancer gene file. oncokb_genes Path OncoKB database file. virusbreakend_tsv Path VIRUSBreakend summary file. virusbreakend_vcf Path VIRUSBreakend VCF file. purple_purity Path purple.purity.tsv. purple_qc Path purple.qc. purple_som_cnv_ann Path annotated prioritised purple.cnv.somatic.tsv. purple_som_cnv Path purple.cnv.somatic.tsv. purple_som_gene_cnv Path purple.cnv.gene.tsv. purple_som_snv_vcf Path purple.somatic.vcf.gz. somatic_snv_vcf Path somatic-PASS.vcf.gz SNV VCF. somatic_snv_summary Path somatic_snv_summary.json JSON. somatic_sv_tsv Path SV TSV file. somatic_sv_vcf Path SV VCF file. result_outdir Path directory write tidy JSON/TSV results. tumor_name Name tumor sample. dragen_hrd Path DRAGEN hrdscore.csv file (optional). out_file Path output HTML file (needs '.html' suffix) (def: {tumor_name}_cancer_report.html). quiet Suppress log printing rendering.

title: Generate UMCCR Cancer Report ‚Äî cancer_rmd
text: Path rendered HTML report.

what: Count Number of Parts in a String ‚Äî count_pieces
title: Count Number of Parts in a String ‚Äî count_pieces
text: Counts number pieces string separated pattern. empty string, returns 0. pattern found, returns 1. pattern found , returns 2 (two pieces), etc.

title: Count Number of Parts in a String ‚Äî count_pieces
Count Number of Parts in a String ‚Äî count_pieces
text: x Input string. sep Pattern count .

title: Count Number of Parts in a String ‚Äî count_pieces
text: Number parts.

title: Count Number of Parts in a String ‚Äî count_pieces
code: (a <- gpgr:::count_pieces("foo,bar,baz", sep = ",")) #> [1] 3 (b <- gpgr:::count_pieces("foo", sep = ",")) #> [1] 1 (k <- gpgr:::count_pieces("", sep = ",")) #> [1] 0 (m <- gpgr:::count_pieces(",", sep = ",")) #> [1] 2

title: Parse DRAGEN HRD File ‚Äî dragen_hrd
text: Tibble single row following score columns: HRD (homologous recombination deficiency) LOH (loss heterozygosity) TAI (telomeric allelic imbalance) LST (large-scale state transitions) input provided, fields NA.

what: HRDetect and CHORD Summary Table ‚Äî hrd_results_tabs
title: HRDetect and CHORD Summary Table ‚Äî hrd_results_tabs
text: Return summary table HRDetect CHORD results.

title: HRDetect and CHORD Summary Table ‚Äî hrd_results_tabs
HRDetect and CHORD Summary Table ‚Äî hrd_results_tabs
text: hrdetect_res Result running sigrap::hrdetect_run(). chord_res Result running sigrap::chord_run(). dragen_res Result running dragen_hrd().

title: HRDetect and CHORD Summary Table ‚Äî hrd_results_tabs
text: list tibble gt_tbl object (see gt::gt()).

title: HRDetect and CHORD Summary Table ‚Äî hrd_results_tabs
code: if (FALSE) { snv <- system.file("extdata/umccrise/snv/somatic-ensemble-PASS.vcf.gz", package = "gpgr") sv <- system.file("extdata/umccrise/sv/manta.vcf.gz", package = "gpgr") cnv <- system.file("extdata/purple/purple.cnv.somatic.tsv", package = "gpgr") nm <- "SampleA" genome <- "hg38" snvoutdir <- tempdir() hrdetect_res <- sigrap::hrdetect_run(nm, snv, sv, cnv, genome, snvoutdir) chord_res <- sigrap::chord_run(   vcf.snv = snv, sample.name = nm,   df.sv = gpgr:::chord_mantavcf2df(sv) ) dragen_res <- gpgr::dragen_hrd("path/to/sample.hrdscore.csv") hrd_results_tabs(hrdetect_res = hrdetect_res, chord_res = chord_res, dragen_res = dragen_res) }

what: Does the input file look like a VCF? ‚Äî is_vcf
title: Does the input file look like a VCF? ‚Äî is_vcf
text: Quickly checks input file 'vcf' 'vcf.gz' suffix, column names correspond typical VCF column headers.

title: Does the input file look like a VCF? ‚Äî is_vcf
Does the input file look like a VCF? ‚Äî is_vcf
text: x Path file.

title: Does the input file look like a VCF? ‚Äî is_vcf
text: TRUE input file inferred VCF, FALSE otherwise.

title: Does the input file look like a VCF? ‚Äî is_vcf
code: x <- system.file("extdata/umccrise/snv/somatic-ensemble-PASS.vcf.gz", package = "gpgr") (y <- is_vcf(x)) #> [1] TRUE tmp_file <- tempfile(pattern = "fakeFile", fileext = "vcf") writeLines(c("col1\tcol2\tcol3", "1\t2\t3"), con = tmp_file) (z <- is_vcf(tmp_file)) #> VCF main column names are incorrect. They are: #> col1, col2, col3. #> They should include at the beginning: #> #CHROM, POS, ID, REF, ALT, QUAL, FILTER, INFO. #> [1] FALSE

what: Process PURPLE CNV Gene File for UMCCRISE ‚Äî purple_cnv_som_gene_process
title: Process PURPLE CNV Gene File for UMCCRISE ‚Äî purple_cnv_som_gene_process
text: Processes purple.cnv.gene.tsv file. Keeps genes UMCCR cancer gene list (v24.03.0) selects columns interest.

title: Process PURPLE CNV Gene File for UMCCRISE ‚Äî purple_cnv_som_gene_process
Process PURPLE CNV Gene File for UMCCRISE ‚Äî purple_cnv_som_gene_process
text: x Path purple.cnv.gene.tsv file. g Path gene file containing least three columns: ensembl_gene_symbol: gene name (character). tsgene: gene tumor suppressor (TRUE/FALSE). oncogene: gene oncogene (TRUE/FALSE).

title: Process PURPLE CNV Gene File for UMCCRISE ‚Äî purple_cnv_som_gene_process
text: List two elements: tab: Tibble filtered genes found  g. descr: Description tibble columns.

title: Process PURPLE CNV Gene File for UMCCRISE ‚Äî purple_cnv_som_gene_process
code: x <- system.file("extdata/purple/purple.cnv.gene.tsv", package = "gpgr") g <- system.file("extdata/ref/somatic_panel-v24.03.0.tsv", package = "gpgr") (pp <- purple_cnv_som_gene_process(x, g)) #> $tab #> # A tibble: 5 √ó 14 #>   gene   minCN maxCN chrom   start     end chrBand onco_or_ts transcriptID    #>   <chr>  <dbl> <dbl> <fct>   <int>   <int> <chr>   <chr>      <chr>           #> 1 SDHA    5.66  5.66 chr5   218303  257082 p15.33  tsgene     ENST00000264932 #> 2 DUSP22  4.66  4.66 chr6   291630  351355 p25.3   tsgene     ENST00000419235 #> 3 IRF4    4.66  4.66 chr6   391752  411443 p25.3   oncogene   ENST00000380956 #> 4 KDM5A   4.30  4.30 chr12  280057  389320 p13.33  oncogene   ENST00000399788 #> 5 CRLF2   3.73  3.73 chrX  1187549 1212723 p22.33  oncogene   ENST00000400841 #> # title: Does the TSV file contain any non-header rows? ‚Äî tsv_is_empty
code: tsv_is_empty(   x,   comment = "##",   col_types = readr::cols(.default = "c"),   n_max = 1,   ... )

title: Does the TSV file contain any non-header rows? ‚Äî tsv_is_empty
text: x Path TSV file. comment Taken readr::read_tsv(). col_types Taken readr::read_tsv(). n_max Taken readr::read_tsv(). ... arguments passed readr::read_tsv().

title: Does the TSV file contain any non-header rows? ‚Äî tsv_is_empty
text: TRUE least one non-header row TSV, FALSE otherwise.

title: Does the TSV file contain any non-header rows? ‚Äî tsv_is_empty
code: tmp1 <- tempfile() writeLines(c("col1\tcol2\tcol3", "1\t2\t3"), con = tmp1) (a <- tsv_is_empty(tmp1)) #> [1] FALSE  tmp2 <- tempfile() writeLines(c("col1\tcol2\tcol3"), con = tmp2) (b <- tsv_is_empty(tmp2)) #> /tmp/RtmpI6emSI/file199d2ef956c3 does not contain any non-header rows. #> [1] TRUE  tmp3 <- tempfile() writeLines(c("##meta1", "##meta2", "col1\tcol2\tcol3"), con = tmp3) (c <- tsv_is_empty(tmp3)) #> /tmp/RtmpI6emSI/file199d7118fe99 does not contain any non-header rows. #> [1] TRUE

what: Does the VCF file contain any variants? ‚Äî vcf_is_empty
title: Does the VCF file contain any variants? ‚Äî vcf_is_empty
text: Checks VCF file contains variants.

title: Does the VCF file contain any variants? ‚Äî vcf_is_empty
Does the VCF file contain any variants? ‚Äî vcf_is_empty
text: x Path VCF file.

title: Does the VCF file contain any variants? ‚Äî vcf_is_empty
text: TRUE least one variant VCF, FALSE otherwise.

title: Does the VCF file contain any variants? ‚Äî vcf_is_empty
code: x <- system.file("extdata/umccrise/snv/somatic-ensemble-PASS.vcf.gz", package = "gpgr") (y <- vcf_is_empty(x)) #> [1] FALSE  tmp1 <- tempfile(pattern = "fakeFile", fileext = "vcf") writeLines(c("col1\tcol2\tcol3", "1\t2\t3"), con = tmp1) if (FALSE) { vcf_is_empty(tmp1) }  vcf_cols <- c(   "#CHROM", "POS", "ID", "REF", "ALT", "QUAL",   "FILTER", "INFO", "FORMAT" ) tmp2 <- tempfile(pattern = "fakeFile", fileext = "vcf") writeLines(paste(vcf_cols, collapse = "\t"), con = tmp2) (z <- vcf_is_empty(tmp2)) #> /tmp/RtmpI6emSI/fakeFile199d300bccb4vcf does not contain any non-header rows. #> [1] TRUE  tmp3 <- tempfile(pattern = "fakeFile", fileext = "FOO") writeLines(paste(vcf_cols, collapse = "\t"), con = tmp3) if (FALSE) { vcf_is_empty(tmp3) }

title: gpgr 2.2.1
text: dragen_hrd parameter cancer_rmd() function now defaults NULL CLI --dragen_hrd argument longer required Report handles missing DRAGEN HRD data showing ‚ÄúMissing‚Äù HRD summary Added warning message DRAGEN HRD file supplied via CLI

text: Added gcContent column support purple_cnv_som_gene_read() function {tumor_name}.purple.cnv.gene.tsv files Added TincLevel ChimerismPercentage columns support purple_qc_read() function {tumor_name}.purple.qc.tsv files

title: gpgr 2.1.3
text: Replace GRIDSS-specific SR/PR metrics eSVee VF/DF/SF metrics Remove SR PR plots, update use SF/DF plots breakends Update SV processing handle eSVee format new breakpoint matching logic Temporarily disable CHORD functionality due compatibility issues eSVee calls Remove MSI fields cancer report summary table - always 0 since PURPLE 4.1 (sash#7) Adapt Breakend ID assignment mate matching SV Map table eSVee (issue89) üîß filter PoN SV cancer report tables (sash#8)

title: gpgr 2.1.1
text: üêõ updating gene panel, fixes pass devtools checks pkgdown (pr82)

title: gpgr 2.1.0
text: üêõ minor fixes canrep (pr81).

title: gpgr 2.0.0
text: ‚≠ê add DRAGEN HRD canrep (issue71 pr72). ‚≠ê add BCFtools stats QUAL plot somatic small variants ((issue70, pr73). üîß remove LINX support (pr74). ‚≠ê switch Umccrise sash inputs canrep (pr68).

title: gpgr 1.5.0
text: add bpi status canrep summary table also updated relevant DVC file üêõ LINX >= 1.24 added reportableReasons fusion table (issue64, pr65). üêõ pkgdown config needs .yml, .yaml suffix (see r-lib/pkgdown#2244) (ci040bd2f). ‚≠ê build conda pkg R v4.2 (ci0dbe49d). ‚≠ê added row counts tabs LINX report PR. üîß use micromamba GitHub Action

title: gpgr 1.4.0
text: üêõ Update LINX cluster plot path pattern (issue50, pr51). add hypermutated status canrep summary table üêõ Handle empty BPI Start/End values (pr55, issue54, umccrise issue88). üêõ gt v0.7.0 requires unique id tab_spanner (issue57, pr58).

title: gpgr 1.3.0 (2022-06-10)
text: ‚≠ê Add Docker support (pr49). ‚≠ê Add conda-lock support (pr49). üêõ Fix cancer report bugs (pr48). Modularised CLI subparsers separate files üîß Refactored cancer report use {sigrap} pkg signature tools. üîß factorise ClusterId LINX VisSvData table (pr46). üîß subset multiqc columns (commit-b7331db).

title: gpgr 1.2.0 (2022-02-07)
text: ‚≠ê Support DVC (pr43, issue41). üîß Fixes LINX tables (pr40). üîß Bug fix LINX CLI (8e89ac6).

title: gpgr 1.1.0 (2022-01-12)
text: ‚≠ê Add LINX RMarkdown report. ‚≠ê Added script tidying umccrised MultiQC JSON output (pr38). ‚≠ê Add CLI LINX reporter (pr39). üîß Add LINX description tibble refactor LINX code (pr36).

title: gpgr 1.0.0 (2021-12-22)
text: Major change: Moving signature tool wrappers (CHORD, HRDetect, MutationalPatterns) sigrap (https://github.com/umccr/sigrap) (pr35). Support LINX tables (pr34).

title: gpgr 0.2.0 (2021-11-23)
text: new release year freezer ‚≠ê add CLI CHORD, HRDetect MutationalPatterns (pr26, pr28, issue17) ‚≠ê add 6 new SBS signatures March 2021 COSMIC release (v3.2) (issue22, pr23) ‚≠ê update use base pipe operator (|>) introduced R 4.1 (pr24) ‚≠ê add handy get_genome_obj function returns BSgenome object, provided ‚ÄòhgXX‚Äô string (useful MutationalPatterns & CHORD) (pr20) ‚≠ê add handy pkg_exists function checks specified R package exists local system (pr20) ‚ùì add readr::local_edition(1) readr::read_tsv due readr using vroom hood (‚Äôm comfortable , anyway). See https://www.tidyverse.org/blog/2021/07/readr-2-0-0/#readr-2nd-edition. think happens ‚Äôm using comment parameter read gzipped VCF. Oh well (pr21) üîß use bumpversion updating pkg versions (issue18, pr19) üîß add pre-commit hooks styler (issue25, pr27)

title: gpgr 0.1.0 (2020-11-19)
text: PURPLE CNVs SVs (tables + BND plots) AF (summary + plot) HRD write final tables tsv + json Support MutationalPatterns v3.0 (https://github.com/UMCUGenetics/MutationalPatterns) Support PURPLE v2.51+

title: gpgr 0.0.6 (2020-10-09)
text: Support CHORD (https://github.com/UMCUGenetics/CHORD) Support HRDetect (https://github.com/Nik-Zainal-Group/signature.tools.lib) Support PURPLE (https://github.com/hartwigmedical/hmftools/tree/master/purple) R package webpage deployed via GitHub Actions https://umccr.github.io/gpgr/
